value: — a large, old town, famous for its beautiful kremlin
— the region's northernmost town is young with an impressive history of prominent work in the sciences, especially in physics, and is home to the world's largest Lenin statue
— a mid-sized city with a prominent historical role in the Soviet aerospace industry, but its mostly just a satellite city for Moscow commuters
— a small city best known as the former residence of Pyotr Ilich Tchaikovsky; the manor where he composed
(Kaliningrad) — the "cradle of space exporation," and home to the house-museums of Lenin and Marina Tsvetaeva
— a small city most famous for its apricot, neo-gothic 18th century Marfino Palace, but also for its other stately estates and old churches
— a fairly large city known for its 18th century aqueduct
— this city served as the summer retreat for poets Baratynsky, Tyutchev, and Mayakovsky; museums remember the writers at Muranovo Estate and Mayakovsky's dacha
— home to the Trinity Monastery of Saint Sergius, the spiritual center of the Russian Orthodox Church
— a relatively large city to the northwest of Moscow on the Klyazma River
